episodeTitle: To Fulfill the Promise - Separate Departures!
description: After Sabo's death, Ace and Luffy continue their training in the forest. Seven years later, Ace departs to begin his pirate journey. Three years after that, Luffy sets sail and defeats the Lord of the Coast, the same Sea King that took Shanks' arm. In the present, Luffy struggles with the grief of losing Ace.

events.title: Ace and Luffy Continue Training After Sabo's Death
events.description: Following Sabo's apparent death, Ace and Luffy intensify their training in the forest. They strengthen themselves through daily battles, working to become stronger pirates. Ace becomes increasingly protective of his younger brother.
events.significance: Shows the brothers' resolve to honor Sabo's memory and grow stronger, establishing the foundation for their future as pirates.

events.title: Dragon Rescues Mysterious Person
events.description: On the Revolutionary Army ship, Dragon returns carrying someone while Ivankov questions him. Revolutionary Army members urgently call for a doctor, revealing Dragon has rescued someone important. The person's identity is not revealed in this episode.
events.significance: This scene foreshadows the revelation that Sabo survived and was rescued by Dragon, becoming a member of the Revolutionary Army. This wouldn't be confirmed until much later in the series.

quotes.text: You! Quickly, bring a doctor! This is an emergency!
quotes.speaker: Revolutionary Army Member
quotes.context: Calling for medical aid for the person Dragon rescued

events.title: Dragon Departs for Baltigo
events.description: Dragon tells Ivankov that he has attracted too much attention and must depart for Baltigo, the Revolutionary Army's headquarters. This establishes the location of the Revolutionary Army's base.
events.significance: First mention of Baltigo as the Revolutionary Army's headquarters, adding to the world-building of the series.

events.title: Ace Protects Luffy from Bear Attack
events.description: During their training, Luffy is nearly mauled by a bear. Ace saves him and becomes more protective of Luffy, showing the deepening of their brotherly bond. This moment solidifies Ace's role as Luffy's guardian.
events.significance: Demonstrates Ace's protective nature toward Luffy and strengthens their bond as brothers, which becomes crucial context for Ace's sacrifice at Marineford.

events.title: Ace Promises Not to Die
events.description: After Luffy tearfully expresses his desire to become stronger to protect those he loves, Ace punches him and promises that he will not die because he has a weak little brother to take care of. This promise becomes tragically ironic later.
events.significance: This promise highlights Ace's commitment to protecting Luffy, making his eventual death at Marineford even more emotionally devastating.

quotes.text: I won't die. I have a weak little brother to take care of.
quotes.speaker: Portgas D. Ace
quotes.context: Ace's promise to Luffy, which becomes tragically ironic given his death at Marineford

events.title: Ace Departs from Goa Kingdom
events.description: After seven years of intensive training, seventeen-year-old Ace departs from the Goa Kingdom to begin his journey as a pirate. He leaves without saying goodbye to Dadan in person, but leaves her a simple message of thanks.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of Ace's pirate career, which will eventually lead to him joining the Whitebeard Pirates and the events at Marineford.

events.title: Dadan's Emotional Breakdown
events.description: When Dadan's bandits inform her that Ace has left and relay his message of 'Thank you,' she initially appears impassive and calls him an 'ungrateful little pissant.' However, she then bursts into tears, revealing her deep maternal love for Ace despite her tough exterior.
events.significance: Reveals the depth of Dadan's love for Ace and Luffy, showing that beneath her rough mountain bandit persona, she truly cared for the boys as if they were her own children.

quotes.speaker: Portgas D. Ace
quotes.context: Ace's final message to Dadan before departing

events.title: Luffy Departs from Goa Kingdom
events.description: Three years after Ace's departure, seventeen-year-old Luffy bids farewell to Makino, the Mayor, Dadan, and the villagers of Windmill Village. He sets off on his journey to the Grand Line to become King of the Pirates, finally fulfilling the promise he made to Shanks.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of Luffy's journey that leads directly to the events of Episode 1. This is a full-circle moment showing Luffy's departure from his perspective.

quotes.text: I'm going to be King of the Pirates!
quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's declaration as he departs from his home

events.title: Luffy Defeats the Lord of the Coast
events.description: Shortly after departing, Luffy encounters the Lord of the Coast, the same Sea King that ate Shanks' arm ten years earlier. Using his Gomu Gomu no Pistol technique, Luffy easily defeats the creature, demonstrating how much he has grown. This scene is properly animated for the first time in the anime.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's growth and readiness to begin his journey. Defeating the creature that caused Shanks to lose his arm symbolizes Luffy's progress toward becoming a great pirate worthy of returning the straw hat.

quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's attack that defeats the Lord of the Coast

events.title: Luffy's Grief and Self-Doubt
events.description: Back in the present timeline on Amazon Lily, Luffy proclaims to Jinbe that he is too weak and cannot become Pirate King, showing his overwhelming grief and despair over losing Ace. He feels he failed to protect his brother despite all his training and promises.
events.significance: Shows the devastating emotional impact of Ace's death on Luffy. This moment of complete despair sets up Luffy's eventual realization that he still has his crew and his need to become stronger, leading to the two-year training period.

quotes.text: I'm too weak... I can't be the Pirate King.
quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy

quotes.text: I won't die. I have a weak little brother to take care of.
quotes.speaker: Portgas D. Ace
quotes.context: Ace's promise to Luffy during their training

quotes.speaker: Portgas D. Ace
quotes.context: Ace's final message to Dadan before departing

quotes.text: I'm going to be King of the Pirates!
quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's declaration as he departs from Windmill Village

quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy defeating the Lord of the Coast

quotes.text: I'm too weak... I can't be the Pirate King.
quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's despair in the present timeline

themes.description: The episode explores the deep bond between Ace and Luffy, showing how they supported each other after Sabo's death and how their promise to become stronger pirates drove them forward.
themes.symbolism: The brothers' training together represents their shared grief and determination to honor Sabo's memory.

themes.description: Both Ace and Luffy's departures from Goa Kingdom represent their transitions from boys to men, as they leave the safety of home to pursue their dreams of piracy.
themes.symbolism: Defeating the Lord of the Coast symbolizes Luffy's readiness to begin his journey and his growth from the boy who couldn't protect himself to a capable pirate.

themes.description: The episode contrasts the hopeful flashbacks of the brothers' departures with Luffy's present-day grief over Ace's death, showing how loss can shatter even the strongest determination.
themes.symbolism: Dadan's tears when Ace leaves foreshadow the grief she will experience when she learns of his death.

themes.description: Ace's promise not to die because he has a little brother to protect becomes tragically ironic, as he ultimately sacrifices himself to save Luffy at Marineford.
themes.symbolism: The promise represents Ace's commitment to protecting Luffy, even at the cost of his own life.

characterSpotlights.development: Shows Ace's growth from a boy grieving his brother Sabo to a confident young man ready to become a pirate. His protective nature toward Luffy is emphasized, and his departure marks a major turning point in his life.

Departs from Goa Kingdom to begin his pirate journey
Leaves message of thanks for Dadan
quotes: I won't die. I have a weak little brother to take care of.

characterSpotlights.development: The episode shows both young Luffy's determination to become stronger and present-day Luffy's complete despair after losing Ace. This contrast emphasizes how devastating Ace's death was to Luffy's psyche.

characterSpotlights.development: Despite her rough exterior, Dadan's emotional breakdown when Ace leaves reveals her deep maternal love for the boys she raised. Her tears foreshadow the grief she will experience when she learns of Ace's death.
keyActions: Breaks down in tears despite trying to maintain tough exterior

characterSpotlights.development: Dragon's actions in rescuing the mysterious person (later revealed to be Sabo) show his role in saving those who need help, adding to his enigmatic character.

Tells Ivankov about departing for Baltigo

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime added an imagination of Sabo appearing to encourage Luffy during training, whereas the manga showed him succeeding on the first attempt.
Luffy's defeat of the Lord of the Coast receives proper animation for the first time in this episode. In Episode 1 and Episode 4, this event was only briefly shown or referenced.

trivia.fact: This is the first time in the anime that Luffy's defeat of the Lord of the Coast is properly animated and shown in detail.
The mysterious person Dragon rescues in this episode is later revealed to be Sabo in Episode 663 and Episode 737.
This episode adapts content from two manga chapters that are 588 chapters apart: Chapter 1 (pages 48-53) and Chapter 589 (pages 7-19).

sources.title: List of One Piece Episode to Chapter Conversion

trivia.fact: Episode 504 is the final episode of the Post-War Arc flashback sequence focusing on Luffy, Ace, and Sabo's childhood.
Baltigo, the Revolutionary Army headquarters, is first mentioned by name in this episode.
One Piece did not have ending themes from episode 279 to episode 1070. Episode 504 falls within this range, so it only features the opening theme 'Fight Together'.
